qas.question: What is the upper age limit for contestants on American Idol?
When was the age limit increased to 28?
Currently, contestants can not have a recording track by what stage of the competition?

context: The eligible age-range for contestants is currently fifteen to <a0_0>twenty-eight<a0_0/> years old. The initial age limit was sixteen to twenty-four in the first three seasons, but the upper limit was raised to twenty-eight in <a1_0>season four<a1_0/>, and the lower limit was reduced to fifteen in season ten. The contestants must be legal U.S. residents, cannot have advanced to particular stages of the competition in previous seasons (varies depending on the season, currently by the <a2_0>semi-final stage<a2_0/> until season thirteen), and must not hold any current recording or talent representation contract by the semi-final stage (in previous years by the audition stage).
